intro: Blutaparon portulacoides, commonly known as the coastal morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the coastline. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in the early morning. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Blutaparon portulacoides is well adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and strong winds.
